Title: 1.1 Requirement Gathering & Interviews
Body:
Description:
Conduct interviews with radiologists and sonographers to gather functional requirements. Section: SRS – Software Requirements Specification; Phase: Product Definition

Acceptance Criteria:
- 10+ user interviews conducted
- Documented feature list in PRD
- Initial MVP defined

Title: 1.2 PRD Drafting
Body:
Description:
Compile requirements into a Product Requirement Document. Section: SRS; Phase: Product Definition

Acceptance Criteria:
- PRD includes features, users, constraints, scope
- Reviewed by stakeholders

Title: 2.1 Wireframe Design
Body:
Description:
Design wireframes for desktop and mobile UI. Section: System Architecture Overview; Phase: UI/UX Design

Acceptance Criteria:
- Wireframes approved by 3–5 medical professionals
- Interactive prototype ready in Figma

Title: 2.2 UI Mockups & Feedback
Body:
Description:
Prepare final UI mockups and gather feedback from doctors. Section: System Architecture Overview; Phase: UI/UX Design

Acceptance Criteria:
- Mockups reviewed and approved
- Feedback incorporated into design

Title: 3.1 Kubernetes Cluster Setup
Body:
Description:
Provision a managed Kubernetes cluster (AWS EKS/GKE) or local cluster (kind/minikube). Section: System Architecture Overview; Phase: Tech Selection & Architecture

Acceptance Criteria:
- kubectl access works
- Cluster nodes are healthy and Ready
- Setup documented in repo

Title: 3.2 Helm & CI/CD Pipeline Preparation
Body:
Description:
Install Helm and prepare initial CI/CD pipeline templates for microservices deployment. Section: MLOps & DevOps Requirements; Phase: Tech Selection & Architecture

Acceptance Criteria:
- Helm installed and functional
- CI/CD templates ready for FastAPI and Frontend services
- Deployment pipeline documented

Title: 4.1 Patient Management Microservice
Body:
Description:
Develop backend microservice for patient records CRUD. Section: Functional Requirements; Phase: MVP Development

Acceptance Criteria:
- Endpoints functional and tested
- Integration test with PostgreSQL passes
- Swagger documentation complete

Title: 4.2 Speech-to-Text Microservice Integration
Body:
Description:
Integrate STT engine (Whisper/Google) for real-time dictation. Section: Functional Requirements; Phase: MVP Development

Acceptance Criteria:
- Audio processed and converted to text
- Error rate <5% medical terms
- Logs stored in MongoDB

Title: 4.3 Report Generation Microservice
Body:
Description:
Develop service to generate structured reports from STT output. Section: Functional Requirements; Phase: MVP Development

Acceptance Criteria:
- Reports generated correctly
- Export PDF and structured format
- Integration test passed

Title: 5.1 DICOM Storage & Indexing
Body:
Description:
Setup AWS S3 buckets and indexing pipeline for DICOM images. Section: Data Management Requirements; Phase: MVP Development

Acceptance Criteria:
- DICOM upload succeeds
- Metadata indexed in PostgreSQL
- Role-based access control works

Title: 5.2 Event Streaming Setup
Body:
Description:
Configure Kafka topics for patient data, reports, and STT events. Section: Data Management Requirements; Phase: MVP Development

Acceptance Criteria:
- Topics created and accessible
- End-to-end producer/consumer test passes
- Documentation updated

Title: 5.3 Data Backup & Encryption
Body:
Description:
Implement backup strategy and encryption for all patient data. Section: Data Management Requirements; Phase: MVP Development

Acceptance Criteria:
- Scheduled backups verified
- Data encrypted at rest and in transit
- Restore tested

Title: 6.1 Compliance Audit & Documentation
Body:
Description:
Prepare HIPAA/GDPR compliance documentation. Section: Compliance & Regulatory Requirements; Phase: Compliance & Release Prep

Acceptance Criteria:
- Audit logs enabled
- Encryption verified
- Documentation approved by QA/legal team

Title: 6.2 Security Testing
Body:
Description:
Perform penetration testing and security audit. Section: Compliance & Regulatory Requirements; Phase: Compliance & Release Prep

Acceptance Criteria:
- All critical vulnerabilities resolved
- Security report approved

Title: 7.1 Prometheus & Grafana Setup
Body:
Description:
Deploy Prometheus & Grafana to monitor microservices and STT pipeline. Section: Monitoring & Observability; Phase: Testing & Iteration

Acceptance Criteria:
- Metrics visible for all microservices
- Alerts configured
- Dashboards documented

Title: 7.2 Logging & Alerting
Body:
Description:
Implement centralized logging and alerting system. Section: Monitoring & Observability; Phase: Testing & Iteration

Acceptance Criteria:
- Logs collected
- Alerts sent on failures
- Documentation complete

Title: 8.1 AI Image Analysis Service
Body:
Description:
Build containerized AI microservice for ultrasound image analysis. Section: Advanced Features Development; Phase: Post-release

Acceptance Criteria:
- Model deployed in Kubernetes
- Feature pipeline tested
- Fine-tuned model accuracy meets threshold

Title: 8.2 Multi-language Support Implementation
Body:
Description:
Implement multilingual support for reports and UI. Section: Functional Requirements / Advanced Features; Phase: Post-release

Acceptance Criteria:
- English, Persian, and other languages selectable
- UI displays correctly
- Reports exported in selected language

Title: 8.3 Advanced Reporting Features
Body:
Description:
Develop automatic report formatting and template system. Section: Advanced Features Development; Phase: Post-release

Acceptance Criteria:
- Reports automatically formatted
- Templates applied correctly
- Export functions work

Title: 8.4 AI Model Monitoring & Retraining Pipeline
Body:
Description:
Implement monitoring and retraining pipeline for AI models. Section: MLOps & DevOps Requirements / Advanced Features Development; Phase: Post-release

Acceptance Criteria:
- AI model performance monitored
- Retraining pipeline operational
- Metrics tracked in Grafana/Prometheus

Title: 8.4.1 Define AI Model KPIs
Body:
Description:
Define performance KPIs for AI models (accuracy, precision, recall, latency, drift).

Acceptance Criteria:
- KPI list documented
- Thresholds defined for alerts
- Approved by AI/clinical team

Title: 8.4.2 Model Performance Logging
Body:
Description:
Implement logging of AI model predictions and outcomes.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Predictions logged with timestamps
- Logs stored securely
- Data anonymized

Title: 8.4.3 Data Drift Detection
Body:
Description:
Detect data drift between training and production data.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Drift metrics calculated
- Alerts triggered on threshold breach
- Results visible in dashboard

Title: 8.4.4 Model Accuracy Monitoring Service
Body:
Description:
Create microservice to monitor real-time model accuracy.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Service deployed on Kubernetes
- Accuracy metrics updated continuously
- Service health monitored

Title: 8.4.5 Prometheus Metrics Exporter for AI
Body:
Description:
Expose AI metrics to Prometheus.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Metrics endpoint available
- Prometheus scrapes successfully
- Metrics documented

Title: 8.4.6 Grafana AI Model Dashboard
Body:
Description:
Build Grafana dashboard for AI model performance.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Dashboard shows accuracy, drift, latency
- Accessible to authorized users
- Auto-refresh enabled

Title: 8.4.7 Retraining Trigger Rules
Body:
Description:
Define rules to trigger model retraining.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Rules documented
- Automatic trigger implemented
- Manual override available

Title: 8.4.8 Dataset Versioning
Body:
Description:
Implement dataset versioning for retraining.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Each dataset version tagged
- Metadata stored
- Rollback possible

Title: 8.4.9 Automated Retraining Pipeline
Body:
Description:
Create automated pipeline for model retraining.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Pipeline runs end-to-end
- Training logs stored
- Failures reported

Title: 8.4.10 Model Validation After Retraining
Body:
Description:
Validate retrained models before deployment.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Validation tests pass
- Metrics meet thresholds
- Approval recorded

Title: 8.4.11 Model Registry Integration
Body:
Description:
Store trained models in model registry.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Models versioned
- Metadata attached
- Accessible for deployment

Title: 8.4.12 Canary Deployment for AI Models
Body:
Description:
Deploy new AI models using canary strategy.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Partial traffic routed
- Metrics compared old vs new
- Rollback available

Title: 8.4.13 Automated Rollback Strategy
Body:
Description:
Implement automatic rollback on performance degradation.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Rollback triggers tested
- No downtime observed
- Logs recorded

Title: 8.4.14 Security & Privacy Review for AI Data
Body:
Description:
Review security and privacy of AI monitoring data.

Acceptance Criteria:
- PHI protected
- Access controls verified
- Compliance approved

Title: 8.4.15 Documentation for AI Monitoring & Retraining
Body:
Description:
Document full AI monitoring and retraining lifecycle.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Architecture documented
- Runbooks created
- Reviewed by DevOps & AI teams

Title: Title
Body: Body

Title: 9.1 Production Incident Response Process
Body:
Description:
Define incident response process for production issues.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Incident severity levels defined
- Response timelines documented
- On-call rotation assigned

Title: 9.2 On-Call Monitoring Setup
Body:
Description:
Setup on-call alerts for critical system components.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Alerts routed to on-call engineer
- Escalation rules configured
- Test alert verified

Title: 9.3 SLA Definition & Documentation
Body:
Description:
Define SLAs for uptime, response time, and support.

Acceptance Criteria:
- SLA metrics documented
- Approved by stakeholders
- Shared with users

Title: 9.4 Bug Triage Workflow
Body:
Description:
Establish bug triage and prioritization workflow.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Bug severity levels defined
- Workflow documented
- Ownership assigned

Title: 9.5 Hotfix Deployment Procedure
Body:
Description:
Define and test hotfix deployment process.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Hotfix can be deployed independently
- Rollback tested
- No data loss

Title: 9.6 Database Maintenance & Optimization
Body:
Description:
Perform routine database maintenance and optimization.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Indexes optimized
- Slow queries reduced
- Maintenance logs stored

Title: 9.7 Backup Restore Drills
Body:
Description:
Periodically test backup restoration procedures.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Restore tested successfully
- RTO/RPO met
- Results documented

Title: 9.8 Dependency & Security Updates
Body:
Description:
Update system dependencies and apply security patches.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Dependencies updated safely
- Vulnerabilities resolved
- No regression detected

Title: 9.9 Performance Load Testing
Body:
Description:
Conduct periodic load and stress testing.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Performance benchmarks met
- Bottlenecks identified
- Report generated

Title: 9.10 Cost Monitoring & Optimization
Body:
Description:
Monitor and optimize infrastructure and cloud costs.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Cost dashboards available
- Unused resources identified
- Monthly report created

Title: 9.11 User Feedback Collection
Body:
Description:
Collect feedback from clinicians and users.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Feedback channels active
- Responses logged
- Action items created

Title: 9.12 Continuous Improvement Backlog
Body:
Description:
Maintain backlog for continuous improvements.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Backlog prioritized
- Items reviewed regularly
- Improvements tracked

Title: 9.13 Documentation Updates
Body:
Description:
Keep technical and user documentation up to date.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Docs reviewed quarterly
- Changes reflected accurately
- Version history maintained

Title: 9.14 Decommissioning & Cleanup Procedures
Body:
Description:
Define procedures for decommissioning unused services.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Cleanup checklist created
- No orphan resources
- Costs reduced

Title: 9.15 Annual System Review & Audit
Body:
Description:
Perform annual system, security, and compliance review.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Audit completed
- Findings addressed
- Report approved
